Title: Planet of the Apes
Writer: Michael Wilson, Rod Serling, Pierre Boulle
Actors: Charlton Heston, Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter
Plot: After being kept in hypersleep during a long expedition into deep space, an astronaut crew crash-lands in the 40th century on a planet where highly intelligent non-human ape species are dominant and humans are enslaved.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. 6 wins & 5 nominations total

Title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
Writer: Paul Dehn, Mort Abrahams, Pierre Boulle
Actors: James Franciscus, Kim Hunter, Maurice Evans
Plot: The sole survivor of an interplanetary rescue mission searches for the only survivor of the previous expedition. He discovers a planet ruled by apes and an underground city run by telepathic humans.
comment: Beneath the Planet of the Apes (1970)

Title: Escape from the Planet of the Apes
Actors: Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter, Bradford Dillman
Plot: The world is shocked by the appearance of three talking chimpanzees, who arrived mysteriously in a U.S. spacecraft. They become the toast of society, but one man believes them to be a threat to the human race.
comment: Escape from the Planet of the Apes (1971)

Title: Conquest of the Planet of the Apes
Actors: Roddy McDowall, Don Murray, Ricardo Montalban
Plot: In a futuristic world that has embraced ape slavery, Caesar, the son of the late simians Cornelius and Zira, surfaces after almost twenty years of hiding out from the authorities, and prepares for a slave revolt against humanity.
comment: Conquest of the Planet of the Apes (1972)

Title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes
Writer: Pierre Boulle, Paul Dehn, John William Corrington
Actors: Roddy McDowall, Claude Akins, Natalie Trundy
Plot: Ten years after a worldwide series of ape revolutions and a brutal nuclear war among humans, Caesar must protect survivors of both species from an insidious human cult and a militant ape faction alike.
comment: Battle for the Planet of the Apes (1973)

Title: Planet of the Apes
Actors: Roddy McDowall, Ron Harper, James Naughton
Plot: Two astronauts and a sympathetic chimp friend are fugitives in a future Earth dominated by a civilization of humanoid apes.
comment: Planet of the Apes (1974 TV series)

Title: Return to the Planet of the Apes
Actors: Austin Stoker, Philippa Harris, Henry Corden
Plot: While on a mission, three astronauts in their spaceship get caught in a time vortex. They return to Earth in the year 3979 A.D. and discover that intelligent apes are now the highest form of life.
comment: Return to the Planet of the Apes (1975 TV series)

Title: Planet of the Apes
Writer: Pierre Boulle, William Broyles Jr., Lawrence Konner
Actors: Mark Wahlberg, Helena Bonham Carter, Tim Roth
Plot: In 2029, an Air Force astronaut crash-lands on a mysterious planet where evolved, talking apes dominate a race of primitive humans.
Awards: Nominated for 2 BAFTA 11 wins & 32 nominations total

Title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
Writer: Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver, Pierre Boulle
Actors: James Franco, Andy Serkis, Freida Pinto
Plot: A substance designed to help the brain repair itself gives advanced intelligence to a chimpanzee who leads an ape uprising.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 21 wins & 43 nominations total
comment: Rise of the Planet of the Apes (2011)

Title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
Writer: Mark Bomback, Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver
Actors: Gary Oldman, Keri Russell, Andy Serkis
Plot: The fragile peace between apes and humans is threatened as mistrust and betrayal threaten to plunge both tribes into a war for dominance over the Earth.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 17 wins & 48 nominations total
comment: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes (2014)

Title: War for the Planet of the Apes
Writer: Mark Bomback, Matt Reeves, Rick Jaffa
Actors: Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson, Steve Zahn
Plot: After the apes suffer unimaginable losses, Caesar wrestles with his darker instincts and begins his own mythic quest to avenge his kind.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 28 wins & 65 nominations total
comment: War for the Planet of the Apes (2017)

Title: Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes
Writer: Josh Friedman, Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver
Actors: Owen Teague, Freya Allan, Kevin Durand
Plot: Many years after the reign of Caesar, a young ape goes on a journey that will lead him to question everything he's been taught about the past and make choices that will define a future for apes and humans alike.
comment: Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes (2024)
